name: biosynthetic
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
made within a living cell or organism, or relating to the process by which this happens: For controlling diabetes, biosynthetic human insulin is an alternative to porcine insulin (derived from the pancreas of a pig). Tumour cells absorb glucose and glutamine to meet the biosynthetic demands of growing and proliferating. Related word
biosynthesis
More examplesFewer examplesChemists have difficulty producing certain hormones artificially in sufficient quantities because the biosynthetic machinery of living organisms is often too complex to reproduce. The integrity of the aortic wall of the heart is closely associated with adequate biosynthetic responses to usual physical stresses.
